text: Map of Massachusetts House of Representatives' 6th Bristol district, 2013. Based on 2010 United States Census. Massachusetts House of Representatives' 6th Bristol district in the United States is one of 160 legislative districts included in the lower house of the Massachusetts General Court. It covers part of Bristol County. Democrat Carole Fiola of Fall River has represented the district since 2013. ==Locales represented== The district includes the following localities: * part of Fall River * part of Freetown The current district geographic boundary overlaps with that of the Massachusetts Senate's 1st Bristol and Plymouth district. ===Former locales=== The district previously covered: * Acushnet, circa 1927 * part of New Bedford, circa 1927 * Somerset, circa 1872 * Swansea, circa 1872 ==Representatives== * Jervis Shove, circa 1858 * William Lawton Slade, circa 1859 * William Gordon Jr., circa 1888 * Charles P. Rugg, circa 1888 * Herbert Wing, circa 1920 * G. Leo Bessette, circa 1951 * Theophile Jean Desroches, circa 1951 * William Q. Maclean, Jr., circa 1975 * Thomas C. Norton * Albert Herren * David B. Sullivan * Carole A. Fiola, 2013-current ==See also== * List of Massachusetts House of Representatives elections * Other Bristol County districts of the Massachusetts House of Representatives: 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 7th, 8th, 9th, 10th, 11th, 12th, 13th, 14th * List of Massachusetts General Courts * List of former districts of the Massachusetts House of Representatives ==Images== 1908 Herbert Wing Massachusetts House of Representatives.png|Herbert Wing 1918 David Kelley Massachusetts House of Representatives.png|David Kelley 1923 Walter Franklyn Douglas Massachusetts House of Representatives.png|Walter Franklyn Douglas 1935 Alfred Bessette Massachusetts House of Representatives.png|Alfred Bessette 1935 Rodolphe Bessette Massachusetts House of Representatives.png|Rodolphe Bessette 1945 G Leo Bessette Massachusetts House of Representatives.png|G.
